entry.title: YTD Calculation in Restricted/Calculated Measure with 200 Dimensions in SAP DataSphere
entry.content:
Context and Goal

We are building an Analytic Model in SAP Datasphere, based on a view with approximately 200 columns/dimensions. Our goal is to calculate the Year-to-Date (YTD) value for the measure "SalesAmount". The YTD calculation must be dynamic, allowing the end-user to analyze the result by Year, Month, and any of the ~198 remaining dimensions in the model (example: Customer, Product, Region, etc.).

Attempted Solutions and Specific Issue
 We have tried to implement the YTD calculation directly within the Analytic Model, following SAP documentation:

1. Restricted Measure Attempt: 

     Expression: We defined a restricted measure for "SalesAmount" with the following filter condition on the date dimension ("SalesDate"):  SalesDate IN (YTD(SalesDate))

     Result: The model fails to activate. Upon deployment, Datasphere throws the following syntax error:

           Reason: Invalid syntax or usage of unsupported function. unexpected character: ->Y<- at offset: 0, skipped 3 characters.

Observation: The YTD() function does not seem to be recognized or supported in this context/syntax, despite being suggested by the expression editor.

2. Calculated Measure Attempt:

  • Expression: We also tried creating a calculated measure using the YTD() function:  YTD(SalesAmount, SalesDate)

  • Result: The outcome is the same; the model fails to activate and shows the identical syntax error related to the 'Y' character.

3. SQL View Implementation (Window Function):

  • Approach: We tried calculating the running total using the OVER (PARTITION BY Year ORDER BY Month) window function within the source view (View Builder).

  • Limitation: This approach is unworkable because it limits the drill-down capability. The calculation is performed only at the Year/Month level, and since it is a calculated column in the view, we cannot dynamically disaggregate the YTD by the other ~198 dimensions in the model (e.g., if we filter by a specific "Customer", the calculated YTD would still be the total across all customers up to that "Month").

4. SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud) - Import Model Test:

  • Approach: We created an Import Model in SAC, and there, the YTD() function (implemented as a calculated account) works perfectly and allows for dynamic drill-down across all dimensions.

  • Limitation: This forces us to lose the Real-Time capability of SAP Datasphere and the Live Connection, which is an unacceptable trade-off for our use case.

Question to the Community

Is there an alternative, supported syntax or method in SAP Datasphere, within the Analytic Consumption Model (or a dynamically aggregate-aware View Builder approach) to calculate YTD while respecting all dimensions in the model?

Any workaround or confirmation on whether the YTD() function in Restricted or Calculated Measures is actually supported in the current version of Datasphere would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

entry.title: Error in data action using attribute within MEMBERSET in MODEL()
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are having troubles with a data action in SAP Analytics Cloud that uses a dimension attribute within the MODEL MEMBERSET. When this process is executed, no sending is made.

This is a screenshot of the step

If I test it using members of the dimension in the MEMBERSET, as for example in this screenshot, the sending is done correctly.

At the same time, if I rewrite the code in this way, it also sends data.

 

 

I wanted to see if anyone else uses dimension attributes for sending data between models, and if so if you also experienced problems running the processes.

I want to remark that this has been developed for quite some time and worked perfectly, it seems to be something fairly recent that stopped working.

Any guidance would be appreciated.

Thanks.

entry.title: ABAP CDS View how to display fields as properties for a Dimension in Live model SAC
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have an ABAP CDS View on an ADSO, for one of the ADSO fields "/bic/z_attivit" I'm trying to display some attributes as properties of the dimension "Attivita" in SAC in a Live Data model based on the CDS View.  I cannot understand what is missing in the code, however I'm not able to see the fields as properties...

Can you please help me and provide any suggestion? this is the CDS View on the Attributes I'm trying to expose: 

 

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZI_ATTVT_ATTR'

@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true

@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@EndUserText.label: 'Attività - Attributi (Tabella P, non time-dependent)'

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

@ObjectModel.representativeKey: '/bic/zAttivit'

@vdm.viewType: #BASIC

@analytics:{

dataCategory: #DIMENSION,

dataExtraction: {

enabled: true,

delta.changeDataCapture: {

automatic: true

}

}

}

 

@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION, #CDS_MODELING_ASSOCIATION_TARGET, #SQL_DATA_SOURCE, #CDS_MODELING_DATA_SOURCE, #EXTRACTION_DATA_SOURCE ]

@ObjectModel.modelingPattern: #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION

 

 

define view ZI_ATTIVITA_ATTR as select from /bic/pz_attivit as p

 

association [0..1] to /bic/tz_attivit as t

on t./bic/z_attivit =p./bic/z_attivit

 

association [0..1] to /bic/tz_mattiv as tm

on tm./bic/z_mattiv=p./bic/z_mattiv

 

{

key /bic/z_attivit as /bic/zAttivit,

key objvers as Objvers,

changed as Changed,

/bic/z_mambito as /bic/zMambito,

/bic/z_ambito as /bic/zAmbito,

/bic/z_mattiv as /bic/zMattiv,

/bic/z_contab as AttivitaFlatSINO,

@Semantics.text: true

t.txtlg as AttivitaDescrizione,

tm.txtlg as MacroAttivitaDescrizione

 

}

 

in the top CDS CUBE i have these reference to the underlying CDS View:

 

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZI_COMMR011_CUBE'

@EndUserText.label: 'COMM R011 – CUBE (base + SERWDET)'

@ClientHandling.algorithm: #SESSION_VARIABLE

@vdm.viewType: #COMPOSITE

@analytics.dataExtraction.enabled: true

@vdm.lifecycle.contract.type: #PUBLIC_LOCAL_API

@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true

@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true

@analytics: { dataCategory: #CUBE } //, dataExtraction.enabled: true }

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #CHECK

@AbapCatalog.buffering.status: #NOT_ALLOWED

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

@ObjectModel.usageType.sizeCategory: #XXL

@ObjectModel.usageType.serviceQuality: #D

@ObjectModel.usageType.dataClass: #MIXED

@AccessControl.personalData.blocking:#REQUIRED

@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #ANALYTICAL_PROVIDER ]

@ObjectModel.modelingPattern: #ANALYTICAL_CUBE

 

define view ZC_COMMR011_CUBE as select from /bic/ad_commr011 as base

 

 

// Attributi per Attivita' (Campo base: /bic/z_attivit)

association [0..1] to ZI_ATTIVITA_ATTR as _ZAttivitaAttr on _ZAttivitaAttr./bic/zAttivit = base./bic/z_attivit and _ZAttivitaAttr.Objvers = 'A'

{

 

//...fields selection

 

@ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_ZAttivitaAttr'

base./bic/z_attivit as /bic/zAttivit,

 

//...more fields

 

_ZAttivitaAttr

}

 

Many thanks for any help.

Filomena

entry.title: Limit the export nodes options for a SAC User with CTMS
entry.content:
I have implemented the CTMS for my SAC. My CTMS is also used for BDC, CPI, GRDC and now SAC.

When i want to export with SAC, I only want the SAC node of my ctms to apear and nothing else. However, in the screenshot you can see, that i also see the other Nodes of my CTMS, but SAC Users should never export to the Datasphere Node of my CTMS for example.

How can i limit the permissions of user to only see the SAC node for export with ctms?

entry.title: SAC: Sorting columns in tables
entry.content:
Dear all,

I'm trying to change the order of columns in a table (measures and calculations). I'm using the optimized story design and the new table experience. The instructions (link below) tells me to mark the columns, do i rightclick and open the sorting order user setting. I cannot see user setting there only apply descending or ascending. Anyone knows how to solve this problem or is it just not possible to change the order of columns in a table?

Best, Moni

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/db2f51a592064c80a3887d077c6672d9.html

entry.title: SAC Certification
entry.content:
Hello everyone, I’m currently preparing for the C_SAC_2501 exam, and I have some doubts about a few questions. Please, I would really appreciate your help to better understand the correct answer to each question.

 

How can you improve the performance of advanced data actions? Note:

There are 3 correct answers to this question.

Use fewer MEMBERSET statements
Use fewer aggregation dimension functions
Use fewer data functions
Use fewer FOREACH functions
Use fewer IF statements

-------------------------

What can you do with a multi action? 

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question. 

  • Run allocation processes 
  • Approve data 
  • Run allocation data actions 
  • Import transaction data 

---------------------------------------

 

You are creating a data action to copy data from one year to the next. 

In the parameter for the source year, which default setting must you change? 

  • Granularity 
  • Level 
  • Hierarchy 
  • Cardinality 

 

 

------------------------------------

When scrolling down in a long table, how can you retain column headers? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question. 

  • Enable Keeping member names visible 
  • Freeze Dimension Header Column 
  • Enable Auto-Size and Page Table Vertically 
  • Freeze Dimension Header Row 

 

 

-----------------------------------------------------

 

What can you do to reduce the data refresh time when opening a story? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question. 

  • Avoid tables with more than 500 rows and 60 columns 
  • Load widgets in the background 
  • Avoid prompts 
  • Use responsive pages 
  • Use conditional formatting 

 

---------------------------------------------------

What is the main benefit a business user can gain from using SAP Business Data Cloud:  

  • Data Management 
  • Data Analysis 
  • Data Integration 
  • Data Intelligence 

 

Thanks!!

entry.title: Data Point Comments on reports with Calculated Measures
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I’m trying to enable Data Point Comments in an SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) table. The issue I’m facing is that Data Point Commenting does not work when a variance is created as a calculated column at the story level.

To work around this limitation, I attempted to create the variance at the model level instead. However, when I try to calculate the variance between Budget Version and Target Version at the model level, SAC does not return the expected values. It seems the model does not allow direct subtraction between different versions.

My goal is to have:
Variance = Budget Version – Target Version
…while still being able to use Data Point Comments on the table.

Has anyone found a way to:

  • Create a variance (between versions) at the model level, or

  • Enable Data Point Comments while using a variance column, or

  • Any alternative modeling approach to achieve this?

Any guidance, best practices, or examples would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you!

SAP Analytics Cloud, connectivity

entry.title: Manage group to team assignments for SAC within Identity Provisioning
entry.content:
Hi experts,

For our BTP landscape and SAP Cloud we have set up a central Cloud Identity Service (CIS) tenant to centralize the user management.

Now, for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) we have configured our central CIS tenant as bundled Cloud Identity Service tenant based on SAP help link:
Authentication Options | SAP Help Portal. 

Following this procedure a source and target system in the Identity Provisioning are automatically created. We just adapted the properties of the source system to include "idds.group.filter" and "idds.user.filter". On the target system we set the user and password according to the OAuth client created in SAC and added properties "ips.delete.threshold.groups" and "ips.delete.threshold.users".

Within the CIS we have following groups maintained for SAC:

CIS GroupSAC team

Technical name:
sac_dev_admin

Display name:
SAC Administrators (on Dev)

sac_admin

Technical name:
sac_dev_planning_user

Display name:
SAC Planning User (on Dev)

sac_planning_user

Technical name:
sac_dev_reporting_user

Display name:
SAC Reporting User (on Dev)

sac_reporting_user

Now, we want to adapt the transformation within the target system for SAC to ensure that all users assigned to the CIS groups will be assigned to the according SAC teams (example: users in group "sac_dev_reporting_user" should be assigned to the "sac_reporting_user" team in SAC)

We tried following:

{
	"user": {
		"condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%sac.group.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%sac.group.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",
		"mappings": [
			...,
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.groups[*].value",
				"preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,
				"optional": true,
				"targetPath": "$.groups[?(@.value)]",
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_admin",
						"replacement": "sac_admin"
					},
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_planning_user",
						"replacement": "sac_planning_user"
					},
					{
						"function": "replaceString",
						"target": "sac_dev_reporting_user",
						"replacement": "sac_reporting_user"
					}
				]
			},
			...
		]
	},
	"group": {
		...
	}
}

Unfortunately, this was not working. Instead all team and role assignments were removed from all users.

How can we handle CIS group to SAC team assignments within the Identity Provisioning when group and team name differ?

It must be ensured that not only the initial assignment can be handled via Identity Provisioning but updates as well (such as changes in the CIS group assignments as well as removal from CIS groups).

 

regards

René

entry.title: SAC Multiactions: Schedule with dependency
entry.content:
Hello,

We have 3 Multiactions in which we load master data, hierarchies and transactional data. It is not possible to use all the steps in one multiaction as it exceeds the limit of 50 steps. 

Now we want to schedule the data loading multiple times in a day and the multiactions should load sequentially, after successful loading of one the next should start. It works fine If we set it up for one occurence. If we want this dependent behaviour to reoccur e.g. 4 times in a day with an end data for example 06.12.2025, then it does not work as it asks which recurring event it is dependent on, which means I have to set up every data load manually. 

For example, if we load dimensions and actuals using two multiactions

First Multiaction task in Calendar to load dimensions:

Second Calendar Task to load Actuals which should be dependent on the first task "Load Dimensions"

While choosing the event it asks which event, means which reccurence 

If I choose all, the dependent task moves to the last occurence, which means all the loading dimensions task should run on every day and "load actuals" will be triggered after the last occurence of "load dimensions"

I have tried different ways like a with a parent process, composite task etc., nothing seems to work. Does anyone have/had similar requirement and how it was solved?

Thanks & Regards,

M.S.

entry.title: How Can Organizations Build a Scalable Data Engineering Architecture to Fully Leverage AI Models ?
entry.content:
I'm currently working with a mid-sized enterprise that wants to scale its AI initiatives, but we’re facing several challenges with our existing data infrastructure. While we already have multiple data sources—CRM, ERP, IoT devices, and third-party APIs—our current pipelines are slow, and our data quality is inconsistent. This is directly affecting the performance and reliability of our AI models, especially those that require near real-time insights.

I’m looking for expert guidance on the following points:

Q: How Can Organizations Build a Scalable Data Engineering Architecture to Fully Leverage AI Models in Real-Time Decision-Making?

If anyone has experience building robust Data Engineering pipelines specifically for AI-driven use cases, I’d appreciate any insights, architectural diagrams, or real-world examples. What pitfalls should we avoid? What steps should we prioritize to future-proof our system as AI demands continue to grow?

entry.title: RESULTLOOKUP/RESTRICT Not Accepting <=, >=, <, > Operators in SAC
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I believe I have encountered a bug in the SAP Analytics Cloud Formula Editor, both at the model level and within stories.

When creating a calculated measure using functions such as RESULTLOOKUP or RESTRICT, the second parameter (which defines the filter conditions) does not accept comparison operators such as:

  • <=

  • >=

  • <

  • >

Whenever I use one of these operators in the filter block, SAC returns the following error:

“Formula could not be computed: Function 'RESULTLOOKUP' expects parameter 2 to be a list of conditions joined with AND. Please complete or rewrite the formula.”

However, using = or != works fine.

 

Restrict with '='Restrict with '<='Restrict with '<' simple example

This limitation prevents me from implementing formulas that require range-based filters.
For example, I need to create a custom YTD calculation that retrieves values up to a specific period entered through a story parameter.

I also need additional measures that depend on parameters (e.g., current period, inception-to-date, etc.).
I found partial workarounds—such as creating restricted measures in the story using “less than or equal” input controls—but this quickly becomes inefficient. Each measure would require its own input control, meaning the customer would need to select the period multiple times, which is not a good user experience.

I also tried using an IF() statement inside a calculated measure, but then I am forced to display the required dimensions in the table, which is not acceptable from a reporting layout perspective.

My starting requirement is to build a report similar to the “Billing Extract for Invoice/Statement” available in:

  • SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud → via the app “Schedule Job for Billing”,

  • SAP S/4HANA on-premise → transaction code GJ12.

To replicate the logic in SAC, I need the ability to filter by period ranges using operators such as <=, which is currently failing in the Formula Editor.

Questions

  • Is this a known limitation or bug in SAC?

  • Is there a planned fix?

  • Is there an official workaround that avoids multiple input controls and avoids exposing dimensions in the table?

Thank you in advance for your help,

poklluka.

entry.title: Unable to access Currency Conversion table in SAC
entry.content:
I'm not sure exactly when this started (probably a few weeks ago) but no one is currently able to access the Currency Conversion table in both our Test and Production SAC instances. I am an Admin and also setup as the owner of the file/table and I am not able to access it either. 

I can see the file in the folder. I can see that the permissions are fine but when I click on it, I get the error message below. 
The instance are in eu20.analytics.cloud.sap

We do have access to a 3rd instance which is in us10.analytics.cloud.sap and it's working fine there. 

What can we do to help address this issue?
